source_note: State baseline derived from Minnesota Pollution Control Agency (MPCA) and county recycling programs; local rules may vary.

organics.guidance: Composting and organics recycling are strongly supported by MPCA; businesses and residents in certain counties must separate food waste.
organics.notes: Hennepin and Ramsey counties require organics collection for some businesses.

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean, dry paper and cardboard; flatten boxes.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle glass bottles and jars (empty, rinsed).

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle aluminum, steel, and tin cans (empty and clean).
metal_containers.notes: Do not include scrap metal or aerosol cans.

plastics.guidance: Recycle bottles, jugs, tubs, and containers labeled #1–#7 depending on local acceptance.
plastics.notes: Plastic film, bags, and foam are not accepted curbside.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: Minnesota does not have a statewide container deposit program.
beverage_containers_crv.bin: Recycle in curbside bin if accepted.
beverage_containers_crv.notes: No CRV or refund system in effect.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle batteries through HHW programs or Call2Recycle locations.
household_batteries.bin: Battery drop-off or hazardous waste site.
household_batteries.notes: Keep out of regular trash or recycling bins.

e_waste.guidance: Electronics are banned from landfills; recycle via county or retailer collection programs.
e_waste.notes: Includes TVs, monitors, computers, and printers.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags and film not accepted in curbside recycling.
plastic_bags_and_film.notes: Film and wraps cause contamination in recycling centers.

bulky_items.guidance: Bulky items must be taken to drop-off sites or scheduled for pickup.
bulky_items.notes: Fees and scheduling vary by city/county.
